description:
In the default mode, it transmits a mail to an SMTP server (for
example at a free mail provider) which takes care of further delivery.
    
To use this program with your mail user agent (MUA), create a
configuration file with your mail account(s) and tell your MUA to call
msmtp instead of /usr/sbin/sendmail.

Features include:

* Sendmail compatible interface (command line options and exit codes)
* Support for multiple accounts
* TLS/SSL support including client certificates
* Many authentication methods
* Support for Internationalized Domain Names (IDN)
* Fast SMTP implementation using command pipelining
* DSN (Delivery Status Notification) support
* SOCKS proxy support
author: Martin Lambers
